text: <@U016BDEQ40J> Thank you for this! I agree algorithms shouldn't be how we measure writing. I'm struggling with how to scale up editing and copyediting on a small team that serves a wide variety of clients with different style guides and wondering if their tools are useful for that. Sounds like that's less how you used it -- but thank you so much for taking the  time to share your experience with me.

elements.text: Thank you for this! I agree algorithms shouldn't be how we measure writing. I'm struggling with how to scale up editing and copyediting on a small team that serves a wide variety of clients with different style guides and wondering if their tools are useful for that. Sounds like that's less how you used it -- but thank you so much for taking the  time to share your experience with me.

text:
The basic version is good for flagging potential errors. But like <@U016BDEQ40J> said, it’s not reliable enough to trust all of its suggestions. 

I just got the budget to test Grammarly Business, which allows you to connect to your style guide. If I could remember to circle back in a few months, I’d offer to tell you how it worked out.
